intro: Wulfenia glanduligera, commonly known as the sticky wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant is known for its glandular hairs that secrete a sticky substance, which can trap small insects. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine,绒毛, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Wulfenia glanduligera thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
